comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The presence of The Garden Palace in the background dates this photo to between 1879 and 1882, when it was destroyed by fire. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5010361286/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] You should add it to your gallery - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/index.php/galleries/garden-pal...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thanks for posting this wonderful picture, a favourite from Series 4481.  I like the man doing impressive things with his hose, and the impression that the fairies at the bottom of this Garden live in a magical Palace.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Well spotted!  I have an idea that many of the series of Botanic  Gardens photos are much earlier than thought, early 1880s.  See comments here - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4272992142/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Good idea; I'm sure the Garden Palace has been 'noted' in other photos, too.

AB
